definition: Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China

sentences.english: This paper attempts to give some discussion on the map which may be related to Matteo Ricci.
sentences.chinese: 文章试图对这幅可能与利玛窦有关的地图加以讨论。

sentences.english: Ricci's map includes pictures and annotations describing different regions of the world.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦的地图包括了图片以及对世界不同地区的注释。

sentences.english: Matteo Ricci was born in 1552 in Macerata in central Italy.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦在1552年出生于意大利中部的马契拉塔城。

sentences.english: Matteo Ricci is of great importance in the history of Chinese western culture communication.
sentences.chinese: 在中西文化交流史上，利玛窦是最具影响的人物。

sentences.english: Matteo Ricci , who died in Beijing in 1610, began the process.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦，谁死在北京1610年开始这一进程。

sentences.english: Ricci was among the first Westerners to live in what is now Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦是最早到现在的北京生活的西方人之一。

sentences.english: Matteo Ricci utilizes the Confucianism tactics, propagates it to study in China actively.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦利用儒学化的策略，积极在华传播天学。

sentences.english: Matteo Ricci and others followed at the court of China.
sentences.chinese: 利玛窦等人随后在法庭上的中国。

definition: Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China/erroneous spelling of 利瑪竇|利玛窦
a Jesuit/member of Society of Jesus
Xu Guangqi (1562-1633), agricultural scientist, astronomer, and mathematician in the Ming dynasty
Lazzaro Cattaneo (1560-1640), Italian Jesuit missionary in China
William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
James Legge (1815-1897), Scottish Protestant missionary in Qing China and translator of the Chinese classics into English
the Church (as Royal Court)/the Holy See/the Vatican
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Earl George Macartney (1737-1806), leader of British mission to Qing China in 1793/Paul McCartney, former Beatle
